messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: grammar
messages.msgSnippet: Hi grammar makes my hair rise off the back of my neck. back when my son was in the 2nd grade i was reading anywhere to three to five hours a night to my boys.
messages.messageBody:
Hi grammar makes my hair rise off the back of my neck. back when my son was in the 2nd grade i was reading anywhere to three to five hours a night to my boys. that was before i started college. he had a paper to write, so i read it out loud to him, and he knew his tenses was off and added more to make the paper sound right to him. he got an A on that paper. and the teacher thought i wrote it. i still do that to my other sons when they need help on papers.
freida

aplan4life <aplan4life@...> wrote:
LOL...I thought that that is what you meant but in the 'schooly'
minded people when one mentions grammar, they mean the eight parts of
speech, sentence dissection...blah, blah, blah. :-)

--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "frozenandcold"
<fivefreebirds@...> wrote:
>
> <<<<When you say 'grammar' are you referring to the eight parts>>>>>>
>
> No, I don't see any need to know what the parts of a sentence are
> called, I am referring to the fact that when you read his writing it
> has good sentence structure and it makes sense.
>
> Heidi
>

messages.subject: re: grammar
messages.msgSnippet: No, I don t see any need to know what the parts of a sentence are called, I am referring
messages.messageBody:
<<<<When you say 'grammar' are you referring to the eight parts>>>>>>

No, I don't see any need to know what the parts of a sentence are
called, I am referring to the fact that when you read his writing it
has good sentence structure and it makes sense.

Heidi
